website_summaries.verdict: This is an inexpensive, simple kitchen gadget including stainless steel blades that slide in three thicknesses, making food prep fast and easy.
pros: Super-consistent results at a low price
Safety features include blade cover when not in use and anti-slip foot that won't slip, even when wet
cons: Only slices flat in three thicknesses, without other cuts like some mandolines

customer_reviews.title: Well built product, flawed design.
customer_reviews.text: I have not seen this mentioned in the other reviews but for me the slices do not come out a consistent thickness. The deck that adjusts the thickness is angled in relation to the blade so as the slice is being cut it gets thinner because the fruit/vegetable starts to follow the flat blade surface, pulling it away from the angled deck that controls the thickness. See picture.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarzan

customer_reviews.title: Should be outlawed.
customer_reviews.text: On the eve of Thanksgiving, I'm in the ER with fingertip on ice (not attached to body). I'm an experienced cook and followed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Slices come out uneven. Thickness adjuster is flimsy and creates an uneven opening between the blade and the bed. This is the only Oxo product I’ve ever given a bad review. Everything else I own of theirs is 5 Star.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Try another brand.
customer_reviews.text: Too flexible to give good consistent slices and too narrow for many veggies. Oxo is usually a reliable brand but this one doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a design improvement from the last one...
customer_reviews.text: I've bought one from this company about five, six years ago and it worked great until the day the blade finally broke. So when I unwrapped this one and began to use it, it was definitely a design improvement. Number one, there is a feature that not only allows you to choose your slice size, but to also close the blade to prevent slicing. When I've finished using the slicer, wash/dry it, it hooks on to the top of the slicer. What a wonderful design improvement. The two stay together in my drawer, number one, and, number two, it protects injuries from occuring when rummaging to find the item. Well worth the price. I'm really pleased with this inexpensive device...
customer_reviews.author: Izzie

customer_reviews.title: Cucumber slices ftw
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. I went to a tea house Last week and had these delicious cucumber sandwiches. I can't get enough of these Damn thin sliced cucumber sandwiches. You can slice a cucumber In a couple of seconds. I've sliced two while writing this post. Sliced apples are good too. Every one needs one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Easy but DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: The plastic guard is too flimsy on one side, so if having even slices is your thing, keep searching. Word of advice; when slicing cucumbers, cut in half and use the grip. I didn’t. I started with the whole cucumber, got into a rhythm and sliced a huge chunk from my pinky. I almost uploaded a photo, but figured that might be over the top. Of course you won’t be able to cut anything wider than the slicer and whatever you are slicing needs to be firm. Squishy tomatoes don’t work great, especially if the skin is a bit tough. All in all not a horrible slicer, but I do wish I’d chosen something else.
customer_reviews.author: Momoo The Mom

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst mandoline I've ever used. There are only 3 settings.... so you can't even slice beyond a VERY thin slice. also, the adjustable surface does not sit flat or lock into place so it's all kinds of uneven going on. Very poor design and in my opinion worthless. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I went to use this I sliced potatoes and the potato was sliding across the blade so easy and fast I thought the potato was just sliding across the top of the blade and wasn't cutting. I wasn't using the guard and I looked down and half the potato was sliced and had I not looked down I would have sliced my finger badly. So YES this slicer works GOOD. But it comes with a warning! Keep a eye on what you are cutting and when the item of what you are cutting gets low and you are not using a guard USE IT! I am so happy I bought this and yes I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Lee

customer_reviews.title: A generally good slicer, was able to cut firmer veggies easily ...
customer_reviews.text: A generally good slicer, was able to cut firmer veggies easily and beautifully thin, but not as much luck on eggplants and tomatoes. I also have issues getting the guard to connect to my veggies, but, I can slice without the guard (as long as I am SUPER careful!) so its all good. I sliced zuccini for some zucchini chips and they were uniform and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Shruti Thaker

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at my mom's house for Thanksgiving, since I'd be flying in and not have my own. My plan was to give it to my brother after, but I liked it so well I kept it. Maybe I'll buy one for my brother as a gift down the road. I have OXO's larger one, which does julienne cuts, but I've always found it a pain to drag out of storage. This one fits in a drawer, makes neat slices easily in 3 thicknesses, and is easy to use and clean. So far I've used it on potatoes, onions, lemons, and cucumbers with nice, even results.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Safety features are missing
customer_reviews.text: Really love this product. It is easy to use and certainly easy to clean. Just run it under water. That's all it takes. Obviously I wouldn't give these many stars if it couldn't cut vegetables. It is flawless in that regard. Unfortunately my mother-in-law cut her finger very deeply when using this tool, as the safety features are just not there. There is a flimsy plastic guard however that gets loose and is easy to remove accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Elfant

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT waste your money. Total trash!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolute garbage and that's exactly where I threw it. No matter what setting I had it on, how I held it, what I used it sliced things VERY inconsistent. Thicker up front and paper thin towards the back. My wife agreed this thing was not worth $15 and we would never attempt to use it again. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: d-rock

customer_reviews.title: Use the protector!  Wish it was designed differently though
customer_reviews.text: This slices very evenly and smoothly. It's imperative to use the protector or you might cut yourself. However, I will say that with potatoes and objects that are larger and rounded it's almost impossible to start out with the protector because it doesn't hold the item steady. Therefore, you start without it and then have to stop when you get to a certain point, or like me, you get cocky and keep going until you accidentally cut your finger.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Even Slices Every Time!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I’ve never used a mandolin before and was a little apprehensive. I trust OXO products so I bought this and I’m making scalloped potatoes for Christmas! I love this mandolin! The potatoes cut quickly and perfectly even each time! It’s easy to use and I just stopped short of the end to prevent injury. You’d have to be very careless to cut yourself with this. I’m so happy I bought it!! Made this job EASY and QUICK! Thank you OXO!
customer_reviews.author: WineLady

customer_reviews.title: Useful for occasional, small recipe calling for uniform, thin slices
customer_reviews.text: I generally like OXO products a lot. This mandolin is not so great, not so versatile, and somewhat flimsy. It offers only a few settings for thickness, all of which are quite thin. I found it useful for a small project, e.g. one cucumber or one carrot. It does enable you to cut perfect, very thin slices. It is worth the price but if you are a really serious cook, this may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Rose S. in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Works well for slicing fruit for food dryer dehydrator
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a slicer that saves me hours of slicing fruit (apples, bananas etc) for the food dehydrator. The knob lets you adjust the thickness of the slices. It's super easy to clean in seconds by hand. I haven't tried it in the dishwasher. The blade is SHARP, for heaven's sake use the grip handle when slicing stuff. Thankfully the blade is protected when stored with the grip handle.
customer_reviews.author: rgn

customer_reviews.title: Does a Great Job!
customer_reviews.text: Just love this gadget. Works slick as a whistle and very pleased I bought it. Love to make scalloped potatoes but always dreaded the slicing. This makes it super easy. I used my hand until I got 2/3 way down on the potato and then used the grabber on the potato. Very sharp blade. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: nenan57

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace the same product we have had for a very long time. It’s great. Ours came from the Outlet. It was perfect in every way except for a dented box. Yes it is sharp and you have to be careful. Use the guard if needed. Always close the blade. We have never had a mishap. We wash it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Too small to be useful
customer_reviews.text: This was just ok - the surface is really too small to do what I need it to do. I use a lot of jicama and potatoes - the potatoes are ok, but the larger items don't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mom reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Blade not properly installed.
customer_reviews.text: The blade was not properly installed so when on the backstroke the vegetables catch on it and cause poor cutting and slowing of the process. I was able to fix it, but it comes loose quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L.

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent slices
customer_reviews.text: I figured this would be safer than my larger, nicer one, which slices beautifully but is confined to the cabinet since it sliced off a fingertip. But this one doesn’t give consistent slices, and it’s slicing only one thickness- too thin. It seemed to work just fine for a month but I’ve had it about a year now and I’m looking to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: hepsy

customer_reviews.title: Slices too thin
customer_reviews.text: There are three thickness options: paper thin, extremely thin, and very thin. If there were a thicker setting, this would be a good product. But it doesn't, and I don't recommend it. It seems sturdy enough. I usually like Oxo products, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, but be careful
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars is taking into account that it's a relatively cheap mandoline. You are getting what you pay for here. It's definitely faster and gives you thinner and more consistent slices than trying to slice by hand. However, it's really difficult to get even thickness with this, I almost always end up with slices that are thicker on one side. You also need to be extremely careful with the blade, it is not that well-protected. If you are very careful using it and don't care if your slices are all perfect, it works alright.
customer_reviews.author: Carol P.

customer_reviews.title: Slices too thin
customer_reviews.text: This thing IS very sharp. However, it seems there isn't much variance between the different thicknesses available for slicing, they all come out pretty much the same. The thickest setting is still very very thin, the thinner two settings are pretty much useless. Nice idea though.
customer_reviews.author: chels_21

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large Mandolin I used to use until I purchased this one. But seriously...USE the tool to slice the veggies with. I was slicing carrots with my hand .. and yup, cut the heck out of my finger. The protecter tool is there for a reason people. If used correctly this product is a fantastic tool to have in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: kk West

customer_reviews.title: Best hand-held mandoline I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have four mandolines: two larger for large parties; and two smaller ones - one of which is this one. Easy to hold and maneuver and not bad in the cleaning department either. Has the necessary safety protectors, and they don't get in the way. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KAR

customer_reviews.title: Great for slicing veggies for a food dehydrator!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my yellow lab is a fiend for dried sweet potato slices. After shelling out $8 a bag a few times, I decided to try to make my own dog treats with a food dehydrator. The Mandoline Slicer was great; easy to use and with a choice of 3 thickness settings I was able to get the perfect thickness for drying. The blade is extremely sharp, so be sure to use the safety tool to push the item across the blade. Easy cleanup and storage with the blade retracted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price cheap product
customer_reviews.text: The reason this product doesn’t get more stars is I have had a little over a month and it’s already broken. Not worth the cheap price. I would buy a more expensive one and get a good quality. It’s not an everyday item that I use, and I’m not one that is hard on my gadgets or appliances. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Rager

customer_reviews.title: be careful with this follow instructionsBe careful with this it’s sharp follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: It’s very sharp I’m a chef I love it but you got a remember to use the guard for regular people because you will take off half your fingers and you won’t even know what do you look down and see blood everywhere so be careful with this follow instructions
customer_reviews.author: Bettina Nicassio Flammia

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Prep Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this to slice onions for a double batch of French Onion Soup-what a timesaver! I was able to get the width I wanted with the adjustable gauge, so the slices were uniform and cooked evenly. I'm anxious to try it on cucumbers when I make pickles. It's easy to clean and I like that it has a safety guard-don't have to worry about someone getting accidentally cut.
customer_reviews.author: KDePuy22

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Be ,
customer_reviews.text: The blade is incredibly sharp. I recommend getting cut proof gloves as I have cut myself twice. It’s incredibly easy to get carried away cutting with this thing which is scary because you could easily lose a finger tip or knuckle.
customer_reviews.author: A&A

customer_reviews.title: very thin slicing
customer_reviews.text: this seemed like the perfect slicer but when you have a carrot or zucchini the thickest slice is still only about 2 coins in thickness. and when you press on it to slide then then the slices are lopsided. (one side thicker than the other) l found that annoying. plus l dont lime my veggies paper thin. if you do this is the device for you.
customer_reviews.author: J. F.

customer_reviews.title: EMT not included
customer_reviews.text: Cut the pad of my pinky finger off the first time I used it. Funny because in my wish list I'd written that it should arrive with an EMT on standby. My finger healed (I bandaged the sliced bit back on and doused it in neosporin). Live and learn. And maybe buy those blade-proof gloves. Now that I know how to use it, my zucchini is sliced perfectly every time and SO fast. It is for making thin slices only (luckily). I love this thing, and moreover, I respect it. Cleans up easily, stores nicely. Great price. Keep away from children and klutzes.
customer_reviews.author: B. White

customer_reviews.title: Great compact unit for small storage spaces
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a compact mandoline for a while because we live on a boat full time and I have a very small galley with little storage. This one fit the bill. It makes great potato chips and slices veggies for salads quickly and efficiently. A word of caution - this thing is VERY sharp and doesn't have a finger guard so use great care with it. Be sure that the blade is in the locked position when storing. Ask me how I know...
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Akey

customer_reviews.title: I used to use a potato peeler for small items like onion and radishes which was still quite time consuming ...
customer_reviews.text: this has been a game changer for my kitchen. I used to use a potato peeler for small items like onion and radishes which was still quite time consuming but now i just slice almost every vegetable I cut using the mandoline. It is EXTREMELY sharp however which i'm definitely not complaining about. I do recommend you use the hand guard however because it only takes one close slice to realize you've just sliced your hand. I've sliced and shaved my finger nails twice now and have been using the guard since! Great product and especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Easy and safe way to slice veggies
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy and simple the product is. It’s just what I needed. I was worried about getting a mandolin slicer because reviews on all mandolin slicers include people slicing their fingers, but if you use the attachment and just be careful, you’ll be fine!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: good quality, cheap and handy.
customer_reviews.text: i got this after a recommendation from a family member and its so great! it has a sharp blade and the three settings are perfect if you're just whipping it out real quick. i have another, larger, multi-piece behemoth that does more than this one packed in a box under my microwave, but this is the one i turn to most often. i highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: nerd_up

customer_reviews.title: Why is this so fun to use?
customer_reviews.text: this is one of the most satisfying kitchen tools i have. its so fun, I am glad they have the veggie holder, because you slice really fast and don't realize you are close to the end of the veggie. Struggles with tomato's, but great for squash type veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Ashli F

customer_reviews.title: Sharp enough to cut a finger off
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mandolin. It’s super super sharp I sliced a large chunk of my finger off because I wasn’t paying attention. The safety features are nice but it’s obviously not idiot proof. Best mandolin I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good slicer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but should of bought the one that looks like a box so what you cut has a better place to fall into instead of trying to do it into a bowl or plate
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Matson

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The clear plastic part broke in a cuple of days very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Sahagun

customer_reviews.title: Simple, cheap, and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Really simple and cheap. I'll eventually move up to a nice mandolin when I have more money. I mainly use this thing while pickling. It's nice when you're making a gallon jar of pickled shallots or cucumbers. I like that the guide piece is actually useful, without it I'd probably have taken chunks of finger off by now.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: You can slice potatoes fast and slick. Be careful, the blade is sharp. I've used several slicers and this is my favorite. The price is great. Both my kids gets one in their Christmas stocking. Great gift idea. love, love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet S

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritic cooks
customer_reviews.text: This mandoline has saved my wrists. I have autoimmune arthritis and slicing fruit and vegetables was taking a toll, and cooking with lots of produce keeps me and my family healthy. I use it over a bowl, which it grips nicely and does not slide around. I purchased this with a food dehydrator, and the level 3 thickness is the perfect slice size for apple chips, and my new favorite thing - mango chips.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Has trouble with tomatoes, but it's priced cheaply. ...
customer_reviews.text: Has trouble with tomatoes, but it's priced cheaply. Wish the blade could be sharpened or replaced. Unfortunately this makes it a disposable product, but I'm not in a professional kitchen using this every day - it'll probably last years, and ease of use/safety is much higher than other products. It's also cheap, but I already said that.
customer_reviews.author: Ramy H.

customer_reviews.title: I was delighted that OXO had a video for this specific product ...
customer_reviews.text: Not quite sure it will become a staple in my kitchen but, as I had never used a mandoline before, I was delighted that OXO had a video for this specific product online. I would be truly ignorant if there weren't great videos for guidance.
customer_reviews.author: CTM

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It doesn't take up a lot of space either. It's easy to adjust the thickness and the super thin onion slices are awesome for salads and burgers. It makes slicing a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: stockjock

customer_reviews.title: Better than you could hope!
customer_reviews.text: I put off making a potato casserole because I wasn't sure this was going to be easy to use. Was I wrong! Had onions and potatoes sliced in 5 minutes! Now on to cucumbers with sour cream.
customer_reviews.author: Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Handy and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I only wish the part that slides to allow different thicknesses for produce was sturdier, it's a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Jille

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Makes cutting a breeze, no matter which veggies you are cutting such nice clean cuts. Very sharp. Great product for the price
customer_reviews.author: april

customer_reviews.title: USE THE NON-SLIP HANDLE
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful, if you use it correctly. The blade is very sharp and the product is practical. It is easy to clean and fits in almost any drawer. It is definitely worth the price and I would 9/10 recommend. The only reason why I can't give this product 5 stars is because I decided not to use the non-slip handle (stupidly) and sliced off a huge chunk of my thumb. I ended up with a full hand/wrist cast and if that doesn't tell you how well this product works then IDK what will!! Long story short, use the recommended non-slip hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Shields

customer_reviews.title: Good for some things, but could use some improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Good for quick jobs where you don't need uniform slices, but the plate that separates from the blade (which controls how thick the slices are) isn't aligned properly, so the left and right side of the slices are different thicknesses. And there are only three thicknesses, with the thinnest around 1/16" and the thickets only around 3/16", so if you need thicker slices this isn't the mandoline for you. However, the blade is SHARP (watch your fingers when you get to the end of whatever you are slicing), so slicing is very quick, and cleanup is extremely easy. .
customer_reviews.author: BJMareski

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this handy tool
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite kitchen tools. I've had it a year and a half and it's still sharp. Great for paper thin, medium and thicker slices. Handy for uniform slices for scalloped potatoes or other vegetables in a hurry. Cleans very easily. I like it so much I have given it to my sister and friends. I store it in the drawer in a plastic bag to prevent injury from the very sharp blade.
customer_reviews.author: P Farrell

customer_reviews.title: This is a Excellent Hand Mandoline
customer_reviews.text: I have another small hand-held mandoline with only one slice thickness setting. OXO gives you three options and I like that a lot. The blade is very sharp, it's easy to adjust and the slices stay uniform in size. I can now make my favorite potato pizza, or easily slice radishes and cucumbers for salads, The safety cover can easily be snapped onto the body of the mandolin so you don't have to chase pats around in a drawer. Excellent price. OXO has a new winner amongst its many wonderful kitchen gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory B. Mowery

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been my whole life!
customer_reviews.text: This makes cutting veggies a breeze!! You can choose the thickness you want. Make sure to use the safety part or you may cut your fingers off! Super sharp!
customer_reviews.author: ASH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: For a single person or small household, this slicer is perfect! Sharp, very ergonomic and easy to use & clean.
customer_reviews.author: SuziB686

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Mandoline
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this simple mandoline. No clunky unecessary accessories, just a good basic compact mandoline.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: It's a handy little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that for the small amount I paid for this dandy little slicer it does a great job. I have never owned one before. I am giddy over the the ease of use and the quality of the slices. I used it to slice mushrooms, red peppers, red onions, and potatoes. I used the finger-protector handle without a single incident of it failing to hold the veggies. No blood was drawn. Not sure why this mandolin is getting negative reviews. Best $14 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Wedding Gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this as part of a wedding shower gift and they really liked it. Said it worked great and was easy to use. Excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for slicing even slices
customer_reviews.text: Thin sliced veggies and fruit this is perfect for my bar tending prep work as we have a lot of thinly sliced garnishes
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Easy Use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean. Used this to make potato chips and dauphinoise potatoes for Thanksgiving. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sanders

customer_reviews.title: The first attempt at using the slicer was not so great because I did not use the non-slip handle and ...
customer_reviews.text: Slicing a large onion took less than 10 seconds. The first attempt at using the slicer was not so great because I did not use the non-slip handle and promptly ended up with a finger cut. Now I always use the handle with the slicer and it has made slicing very easy,safe, and fast. I am not fond of kitchen clean-up so I am very happy that the slicer can be put into the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Regine Duncker

customer_reviews.title: as promised
customer_reviews.text: Like it ...easy to use, no longer skinning my fingers. easy to clean and blade very sharp. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Luckydwg

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Just got delivered. Easily sliced up cucumbers, peppers and onion. Easy to clean. Not sure how long the blade will stay this sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Zero user

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast to use and super convenient
customer_reviews.text: I only ordered this so I could make Ratatouille like the movie, and now I use it for everything! It can slice tomatoes so thin without turning them to mush, which is perfect for sandwiches, and scalloping potatoes and zucchini squash for cheesy casserole. The holder thing for holding the vegetables grips really well and the handle makes it easy to move/angle the mandolin perfectly however I want.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Great Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this slicer. Easy to use and I like the three different settings for thickness.
customer_reviews.author: susan r roth

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It is so handy and does a great job. It is small enough to fit in a drawer but big enough to really do the job for all types of slicing. I blade guard allows you to slice right to the end of the veggie and not waste anything. I had other more bulky mandolins but this one does the same job in a more compact, easy to use package.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: I made zucchini noodle lasagna and this works great. Not sure of the 1
customer_reviews.text: I made zucchini noodle lasagna and this works great. Not sure of the 1,2,3 measurement. I think it’s best to try a slice to see if right thickness. The blade is very sharp so ensure you have items fitted right before slicing. I really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: TW - Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... works okay--and is worth the price--but I was still pretty disappointed. The way that the different thickness settings ...
customer_reviews.text: This works okay--and is worth the price--but I was still pretty disappointed. The way that the different thickness settings work, one side of the surface (the one to which the adjustable part is not attached) is always slightly thicker than the other. For heavier/denser veggies, like carrots or potatoes, this can make me feel like the free-floating side is going to break. It doesn't feel sturdy in my hand, which is a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: ShellyBear

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: We are generally very handy people, but when we tried to use this thing, we both got injured. Ridiculous machine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peyman

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful slices
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting a mandolin for awhile and wasn't sure what kind so I read many reviews on many different ones. I decided to go with this one.....I didn't need it to do anything fancy except slices......I wanted to make lasagna with zucchini slices, and this way I could get it more uniformed. I also used it to slice tomatoes and onions for burgers, worked great!
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: Good slicer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job of slicing up my veggies. I don't need one that does a lot of different styles of chopping. I am happy with the simplicity of this one.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
